Package camzup.pfriendly

Class Up3

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
processing.core.PGraphics
processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
camzup.pfriendly.UpOgl
camzup.pfriendly.Up3
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITextDisplay, ITextDisplay2, IUp, IUp3, IUpOgl, Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
Yup3, Zup3
public abstract class Up3 extends UpOgl implements IUpOgl, IUp3, ITextDisplay2
An abstract parent class for 3D renderers.

  • Method Details

    • beginHud

      public void beginHud()
      Begins the heads-up display section of the sketch. Turns off lighting, disables depth testing and depth masking. Sets the camera origin to the center of the sketch and establishes an orthographic projection.

    • bezier

      public void bezier(Vec3 ap0, Vec3 cp0, Vec3 cp1, Vec3 ap1)
      Draws a single Bezier curve.
      Specified by:
      bezier in interface IUp3
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point

    • bezierVertex

      public void bezierVertex(Vec3 cp0, Vec3 cp1, Vec3 ap1)
      Draws a bezier vertex with three vectors: the following control point, the rear control point of the ensuing point, and the ensuing anchor point.
      Specified by:
      bezierVertex in interface IUp3
      Parameters:
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the next anchor point

    • dolly

      public void dolly(float z)
      Dollies the camera, moving it on its local z axis, backward or forward. This is done by multiplying the z magnitude by the camera inverse, then adding the local coordinates to the camera location and look target.
      Specified by:
      dolly in interface IUp3
      Parameters:
      z - the z magnitude

    • endHud

      public void endHud()
      Concludes the heads-up display section of the sketch by enabling the depth mask and depth test. This should happen at the end of a draw call; any display following this method should call camera and projection methods and set lights.

    • getEyeDist

      public float getEyeDist()
      Gets the eye distance of the camera.

      Returns:
      the eye distance

      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity

    • handles

      public void handles(CurveEntity3 ce, float sw)
      Displays the handles of a curve entity.
      • The color for lines between handles defaults to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_COLOR;
      • the rear handle point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_REAR_COLOR;
      • the fore handle point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_FORE_COLOR;
      • the coordinate point, to IUp.DEFAULT_HANDLE_COORD_COLOR.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      sw - the stroke weight

    • pedestal

      public void pedestal(float y)
      Boom or pedestal the camera, moving it on its local y axis, up or down. This is done by multiplying the y magnitude by the camera inverse, then adding the local coordinates to both the camera location and look target.
      Specified by:
      pedestal in interface IUp3
      Parameters:
      y - the y magnitude

    • setMatrix

      public void setMatrix(float m00, float m01, float m02, float m03, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m20, float m21, float m22, float m23, float m30, float m31, float m32, float m33)
      Resets the PGraphicsOpenGL.camera and PGraphicsOpenGL.cameraInv matrices, sets the model view to the input values, calculates the inverse model view, then recalculates the projection model view.
      Overrides:

      Parameters:

      m11 - row 1, column 1
      m12 - row 1, column 2
      m13 - row 1, column 3
      m20 - row 2, column 0
      m21 - row 2, column 1
      m22 - row 2, column 2
